page.title: 07NATIONAL TRUST RECREATION
page.content: The extensive bridleway network on Blackdown and Marley Common provides a valuable facility for horse riders. There is a jumping area and opportunity for long gallops. They are very open and there are very many picnic areas so you can sit down and eat while holding your pony. Riders must keep to the public Bridleways, They must not leave litter. They must not ride fast along Bridleways if visibility is restricted. They must ride slowly past walkers. There are many fine views and a maze of footpaths which attract weeekend ramblers who come by rail from London. The topography offers a good test for orienteers and runners. Mesolithic man left traces of their way of living by flints which they used for fighting and for working and by burial mounds.
